Class Triangle

java.lang.Object
Triangle
public class Triangle extends Object
This class represents a triangle with a name, base, and height and uses the constructors to create a new instance of the triangle and calculate its area.
Since:
10/26/2025
Version:
1.0
Author:
Arturo Rivera, arivera030@student.sdccd.edu

    Constructors

    Triangle()
    No-argument constructor.

    Constructor that sets the triangle's name, base, and height.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description

    readInput()
    Reads triangle values from the user using the keyboard.

    void

    Sets the triangle's height.
    void

    Sets the triangle's name.
    void
    writeOutput()
    Prints the triangle's details, including area rounded to 1 decimal place.

  • Constructor Details

    • Triangle

      public Triangle()
      No-argument constructor. Sets name to "Unknown" and base/height to 0.0.

    • Triangle

      public Triangle(String inName, double inBase, double inHeight)
      Constructor that sets the triangle's name, base, and height.
      Parameters:
      inName - the triangle's name
      inBase - the triangle's base dimension
      inHeight - the triangle's height dimension

  • Method Details

    • setName

      public void setName(String newName)
      Sets the triangle's name.
      Parameters:
      newName - the new name

    • setBase

      public void setBase(double newBase)
      Sets the triangle's base.
      Parameters:
      newBase - the new base value

    • setHeight

      public void setHeight(double newHeight)
      Sets the triangle's height.
      Parameters:
      newHeight - the new height value

    • readInput

      public void readInput()
      Reads triangle values from the user using the keyboard.

    • writeOutput

      public void writeOutput()
      Prints the triangle's details, including area rounded to 1 decimal place.
